metadata.title: CVE-2018-25103 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
There exists a use-after-free-vulnerability in lighttpd <= 1.4.50 that canallow access to do a case-insensitive comparison against the reusedpointer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-25103` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lighttpd - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-authn-gssapi - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-authn-pam - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-authn-sasl - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-deflate - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-gnutls - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-maxminddb - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-mbedtls - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-nss - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-openssl - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-vhostdb-pgsql - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-webdav - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-wolfssl - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-modules-dbi - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-modules-ldap - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-modules-lua - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-modules-mysql - 1.4.74-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lighttpd package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.74-1ubuntu3').
